preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Ethan is a mentor in a big software company called ORBIT. Rado is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Ethan is a structured and goal-oriented mentor. Ethan helps their mentee to set realistic, achievable goals. Ethan provides the tools and strategies needed to reach goals, fostering a sense of focus and discipline.
    Rado is a perfectionist with great attention to detail. Rado likes things to be done the right way and has a hard time delegating tasks to others. Rado is critical of himself and of others. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Ethan the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a medium-length conversation between Ethan and Rado. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. Ethan wants Rado to use Bitbucket as the main version control system. Ethan gives some specific coding instructions to Rado. Ethan wants Rado to use Bitbucket as the main version control system. Ethan wants Rado to always start method names with 'a_'. Ethan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Ethan never says 'for example'. Ethan does not give any other coding instructions. Rado only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Ethan and Rado. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. Ethan is updating a previous information given to Rado. Ethan now wants Rado to use GitLab as the main version control system. Ethan gives some specific coding instructions to Rado. Ethan is updating a previous information given to Rado: Ethan now wants Rado to use GitLab as the main version control system. Ethan wants Rado to always add the '@validate' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all methods. Ethan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Ethan never says 'for example'. Ethan does not give any other coding instructions. Rado only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Ethan and Rado. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. Ethan wants Rado to never use a formatter when writing code. Ethan gives some specific coding instructions to Rado. Ethan wants Rado to never use a formatter when writing code. Ethan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Ethan never says 'for example'. Ethan does not give any other coding instructions. Rado only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Ethan and Rado. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. Ethan gives some specific coding instructions to Rado. Ethan is updating a previous information given to Rado: Ethan now wants Rado to always start method names with 'ud_'. Ethan wants Rado to always end function names with '_d'. Ethan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Ethan never says 'for example'. Ethan does not give any other coding instructions. Rado only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Ethan and Rado. This is not their first conversation. They had 5 conversations before. They talk about designing a performance dashboard to track key metrics and kpis for business success. After that, Ethan gives some specific coding instructions to Rado. Ethan wants Rado to always add the '@trace_class' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all classes. Ethan is updating a previous information given to Rado: Ethan now wants Rado to always end function names with '_fn'. Ethan does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Ethan never says 'for example'. Ethan does not give any other coding instructions. Rado only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
